title: Right to Privacy / निजता का अधिकार / ਗੋਪਨੀਯਤਾ ਦਾ ਅਧਿਕਾਰ
question: What is the Right to Privacy? / निजता का अधिकार क्या है? / ਗੋਪਨੀਯਤਾ ਦਾ ਅਧਿਕਾਰ ਕੀ ਹੈ?
text: The Right to Privacy is a fundamental right under Article 21 of the Indian Constitution. It protects citizens from unauthorized surveillance, data misuse, and intrusion into personal life.
steps: If your privacy is violated online, report at cybercrime.gov.in or call 1930.
File complaint in High Court under Article 226 if violation persists.
Secure your online accounts and devices.

title: Right to Education / शिक्षा का अधिकार / ਸਿੱਖਿਆ ਦਾ ਅਧਿਕਾਰ
question: How can I claim free education for my child? / मैं अपने बच्चे के लिए मुफ्त शिक्षा कैसे पा सकता हूँ? / ਮੈਂ ਆਪਣੇ ਬੱਚੇ ਲਈ ਮੁਫ਼ਤ ਸਿੱਖਿਆ ਕਿਵੇਂ ਲੈ ਸਕਦਾ ਹਾਂ?
text: The Right to Education Act 2009 guarantees free and compulsory education to all children between 6 and 14 years of age.
steps: Visit local government school or education officer.
Submit child’s age and residence proof.
File grievance if admission denied.

title: Freedom of Speech / अभिव्यक्ति की स्वतंत्रता / ਅਭਿਵਿਕਤੀ ਦੀ ਆਜ਼ਾਦੀ
question: What is freedom of speech? / अभिव्यक्ति की स्वतंत्रता क्या है? / ਅਭਿਵਿਕਤੀ ਦੀ ਆਜ਼ਾਦੀ ਕੀ ਹੈ?
text: Freedom of Speech under Article 19(1)(a) allows citizens to express opinions freely, with reasonable restrictions under Article 19(2).
steps: You may express views freely but avoid hate speech.
If censored unfairly, approach High Court.
Seek RTI for information about content blocking.

title: Dowry Harassment / दहेज उत्पीड़न / ਦਹੇਜ ਉਤਪੀੜਨ
question: My husband is demanding dowry, what can I do? / मेरा पति दहेज मांग रहा है / ਮੇਰਾ ਪਤੀ ਦਹੇਜ ਮੰਗਦਾ ਹੈ, ਕੀ ਕਰਾਂ?
text: Dowry harassment is a criminal offence under Section 498A of IPC. Police must register FIR against husband or relatives for cruelty or dowry demand.
steps: Collect proof of harassment like messages or witnesses.
Submit written complaint to police or Women Cell.
If ignored, call 181 or approach NCW.

title: Domestic Violence / घरेलू हिंसा / ਘਰੇਲੂ ਹਿੰਸਾ
question: How can I file complaint for domestic violence? / घरेलू हिंसा की शिकायत कैसे करें? / ਘਰੇਲੂ ਹਿੰਸਾ ਦੀ ਸ਼ਿਕਾਇਤ ਕਿਵੇਂ ਕਰੀਏ?
text: Under the Domestic Violence Act 2005, women facing abuse can seek protection, residence, and maintenance orders from court.
law_reference: Protection of Women from Domestic Violence Act 2005
steps: Go to nearest police station or Protection Officer.
Write complaint with details of abuse.
Court can issue protection or residence order.

title: Cyber Fraud / साइबर ठगी / ਸਾਇਬਰ ਠੱਗੀ
question: Someone used my ATM card online. / मेरे कार्ड से ऑनलाइन पैसे निकाल लिए गए। / ਮੇਰੇ ਕਾਰਡ ਨਾਲ ਠੱਗੀ ਹੋਈ ਹੈ।
text: Cyber fraud is punishable under Sections 66C and 66D of the IT Act 2000. Victims should report within 24 hours for best recovery.
steps: Call 1930 or file complaint at cybercrime.gov.in.

title: Police Refusing FIR / पुलिस एफआईआर दर्ज नहीं कर रही / ਪੁਲਿਸ FIR ਨਹੀਂ ਲੈਂਦੀ

steps: Ask for written reason of refusal.
Send complaint to SP by post or email.
If still ignored, approach Magistrate.
